721144f-a.text:
Ludlow Street, west side, north from (No. 167), but not including Stanton to East Houston Streets, showing (No. 169) a 3-story frame stable.
December 15, 1916.
721144f-a.folder: Ludlow Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

721145f-a.text:
183 and 181 Ludlow Street, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of East Houston Street (an empty lot), as seen from a clearance on the east side of the street. No. 181, is a 7-story factory building. Also shown are the rears of 5-story buildings (right to left), facing on Orchard Street, and bearing Nos.
200 to 196.
March 13, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
721145f-a.folder: Ludlow Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

719496f-a.text:
(1)
East Houston Street, south side, east from, but not including Ludlow, to, but not including Norfolk Streets. The view shows a playground
built on the former site of Public School No. 13, south side, of East
Houston Street, between Essex and Ludlow Streets. Note the Provident
Loan Association Building at the S.W. corner of Essex Street.
March 30, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a further view eastward.
March 30, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 2. Prominent building shown is No. 2-4 Ave. A,
east side, between East Houston and East 1st Streets.
April 30, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
N ; rr  NEG. ~ 6113
